artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Jesus in loincloth tied to a pillar; a couple of men flog him with a cluster of brush and rope, while others look on; a man at LL gestures to a pile of cloth and ropes at bottom center
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate: [Christ at a pillar heere is scourged by Iewes / in Friers habit, as the Friers use, / to whip themselves, then who can Friers blame, / If what themselves have, they give Christ the same]

numbered in plate at lower right: [8]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Scourging of Christ, From the Satirical Passion
